intro: Trigonostemon dipteranthus, commonly known as the two-flowered trigonostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its triangular-shaped leaves and showy, two-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
